<Title />

Our default font is Open Sans and our [type scale](http://spencermortensen.com/articles/typographic-scale/) is built based on its characteristics and our default sizing value of `1rem`.

## Levels

Our system uses a modular scale based on levels of hierarchy. This scale is based on the [Major Third](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Major_third) (5:4 or 1.25). Given that our base size is `1rem` or `16px` (in most browsers) we can calculate our font sizes from there.

<table>
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>Level</th>
      <th>Calculation</th>
      <th>Size in ems</th>
      <th>Size in pixels</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>0</td>
      <td>
        <code>1em * .75</code>
      </td>
      <td>
        <code>.8em</code>
      </td>
      <td>
        <code>12.8px</code>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>1 (Default)</td>
      <td>
        <code>1em</code>
      </td>
      <td>

      </td>
      <td>
        <code>16px</code>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>

        <code>1.25em</code>

      <td>
        <code>20px</code>
      </td>

## Body text

<Typeset
  fontSizes={[
    Number(typography.size.level0),
